response:
Investigations should confirm optic neuritis, delineate demyelinating lesions elsewhere in the CNS, distinguish MS from NMOSD and MOG-associated disease, exclude vascular, compressive, infectious, and systemic inflammatory causes, and provide baseline safety data before high-dose steroids and potential long-term immunotherapy.

investigations = ["MRI of brain and orbits with gadolinium", "Automated visual field testing (perimetry)", "Optical coherence tomography of retinal nerve fibre layer", "Visual evoked potentials", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Blood glucose", "Serum vitamin B12", "Serum folate", "Serum aquaporin-4 IgG antibody", "Serum MOG IgG antibody", "Antinuclear antibody", "Extractable nuclear antigen panel", "Serum angiotensin-converting enzyme", "Syphilis serology (treponemal test and non-treponemal test)", "HIV antigen/antibody test", "Lyme disease serology", "Lumbar puncture with CSF analysis including oligoclonal bands and IgG index", "Chest CT if sarcoidosis is suspected on other grounds"]
